intro: Cyclorhiza peucedanifolia, commonly known as the European cow parsley, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided leaves and small, white or greenish flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, open habitats such as meadows and woodland edges. It is known for its aromatic foliage and is sometimes used in traditional herbal medicine. Cyclorhiza peucedanifolia plays a role in supporting pollinators and is considered a valuable component of biodiversity-rich ecosystems.
